```{r setup, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)

library(echarts4r)
```

### Boxplot

```{r}
df <- data.frame(
  x = c(1:10, 25, 30),
  y = c(1:10, -6, 15)
)

df %>% 
  e_charts() %>% 
  e_boxplot(y, outliers = TRUE) %>% 
  e_boxplot(x, outliers = TRUE) %>% 
  e_title("Boxplot")
```

## Histogram

```{r}
# data.frame
df <- data.frame(
  x = 1:100,
  y = rnorm(100, 20, 12)
)

df %>% 
  e_charts() %>% 
  e_histogram(y) %>% 
  e_tooltip()
```

## Density

Plot the density on a different Y axis as its range differs much from the that of the histogram.

```{r}
df %>%
  e_charts() %>% 
  e_histogram(y) %>% 
  e_density(y, name = "density", areaStyle = list(opacity = .4), 
            smooth = TRUE, y_index = 1) %>% 
  e_tooltip()
```

## Linear

```{r}
df %>% 
  e_charts(x) %>% 
  e_scatter(y, symbol_size = 10) %>% 
  e_lm(y ~ x)
```

## Polynomial

```{r}
mtcars %>% 
  e_charts(disp) %>% 
  e_scatter(mpg, qsec) %>% 
  e_loess(mpg ~ disp)
```
